name: Objectives

tableData.result: Dig up the oathbreaker’s skull without waking him.
Deliver coin to each pauper grave before moonset.
Silence the bell that rings from an empty crypt.
Rebind the ghost child to her mismatched bones.
Trade names with the gravedigger to cross safely.
Steal the black wreath from the widow’s shadow.
Carry a coffin three laps without dropping once.
Unmask the mourner who smiles during prayers.
Bury your knife to prove you won’t use it.
Win a debate with a corpse over your debts.
Find the grave that eats roses and stop it.
Write the forgotten surname on frost before dawn.
Convince the skeletal preacher to bless the mud.
Return teeth scattered by rats to the right mouths.
Smother the lantern made of someone’s last breath.
Escort a stubborn spirit past his jealous wife.
Untie the blood-knot sealing the ossuary door.
Feed the soil sorrow without telling any lies.
Replace stolen eyes in the baron’s stone effigy.
Harvest nightcress growing from a murderer’s remorse.
Swap headstones to make rivals share eternity.
Gamble with the undertaker for a borrowed heartbeat.
Track the graveworm tunneling under noble plots.
Quench the pyre that refuses to stop burning.
Convince the crows to return stolen wedding rings.
Smash the saint’s reliquary without being seen.
Lay a soldier’s hands in the right order.
Answer three riddles carved into your own name.
Drag a weeping well back into its circle.
Bleed onto soil until it tells you truth.
Lock the jealous mausoleum that opens for adulterers.
Recover a vow buried under seven false dates.
Carry a plague bell through mourners without ringing.
Name each bone in the charnel pit correctly.
Guide a midwife to deliver a stillborn prophecy.
Plant iron nails where the dead keep turning.
Break the pact between worms and grave robbers.
Sew shut the wind that whispers through skulls.
Move a child’s grave before the flood arrives.
Weigh a sinner’s tongue against a silver coin.
Lead the executioner’s ghost to his unmarked trench.
Extinguish candles that relight with each guilt confessed.
Replace the sexton’s shadow stolen by icy dawn.
Bind the laughing jawbone with your own hair.
Translate the epitaph written in rust and gnats.
Carry the queen’s grief across twelve sinking plots.
Bribe clay to keep secrets as you dig.
Find the missing hour buried under a cairn.
Offer your breath so a widow can forgive.
Return the borrowed shovel before it tastes blood.

description: Cemetery is ground that remembers, a place where the living walk on a thin crust of soil over regret, unfinished business, and deliberate forgetting. Names on stone fade, graves sink, and the boundary between “laid to rest” and “not quite gone” is more a matter of courtesy than law.

name: Atmosphere

tableData.result: Cold iron gate sighs, names flake like scabs
Wet earth breathes rot, worms stitch old promises
Thin mist drapes stones, secrets damp and heavy
Boots sink in mud, guilt grips the ankles
Crow on a crossbeam, eye like a nail
Wind tongues epitaphs, misreads them on purpose
Cracked angel smiles, teeth of chipped quartz
Grave dirt under nails, tastes of iron
Sunk headstones lean, drunk on forgotten prayers
Candles gutter, wax weeps like cheap mercy
Shovels clink bone, the past complains quietly
Names rubbed raw, memory bruised but breathing
Ragweed scratches calves, pollen like grave dust
Rain drums lids, a slow stubborn knocking
Unclaimed flowers curl, love turns to mulch
Footprints fill with water, no one follows
Faded ribbons twitch, tied to patient sticks
A fox trots through, tail like a question
Distant bell coughs, then thinks better of it
Marble saints watch, too tired to judge
A lock of hair nailed under slate
Nightjars click, counting debts, not stars
Stale incense clings, smoke sour with grudges
Soil settles, a long, final sigh
Rusted names cut fingers, letters bite back
Red clay stains knees, penance or habit
Coins on a stone, cheap bargains with silence
A child's marble rolls, stops at nobody
Roots cradle skulls, love’s last hard hold
Black dog lies still, guarding nothing left
Fungal blooms glow, sick moons under grass
A preacher whispers, voice eaten by wind
Owl shadow skims, soft as regret
Broken jar of salt, line smeared by rain
Mourners argue low, shame doing the math
Old wreath wire twists, like failed stitches
Moss swallows dates, hunger patient and green
Boot heel snaps, oath breaks with it
Candles ring a mound, all burned uneven
Cold breath fogs, names vanish in steam
Larks refuse to sing, dawn too honest
A spade stands alone, mouth full of dirt
Button found in loam, grief has pockets
Fresh mound steams, earth still remembering heat
Soot on carved wings, prayers came smoky
Frost etches veins on slate, brittle maps
Ants ferry crumbs, funeral of bread
A ribboned cane waits, owner underfoot
Mud sucks steps back, path argues ownership
Wolves watch the fence, manners holding barely
Lichen writes new names, nature forging signatures
Rainwater mirrors sky, clouds wear black too
A jawbone smiles, nobody laughs along
Thin bells count breaths, numbers never agree
Coffin nails gleam, miser’s last bright coins
Dirt under tongue, prayer tastes like rust
A lantern fails, dark takes careful inventory
Weeds stitch cracks, seamstress of neglect
Footstone cold as debt, heel remembers
Hush falls heavy, like a wet cloak
A rook drops trinkets, trades for nothing
Gravedigger hums, song older than pay
White fungus ladders, climbing forgotten sins
A bootprint crosses names, respect negotiable
Rain loosens soil, whispers spill out
A clove of garlic, faith gone stale
Thorns snag sleeves, keep what they catch
Old wine poured, ground drinks without thanks
Candle smoke curls, spelling wrong letters
A prayer book sodden, faith blurs pages
Snow smooths mounds, lies kindly for now
Cracked urn bleeds ash, gray river in grass
Moths circle stone, soft fists on meaning
A bent penny gleams, bargain already broken
Distant laughter halts, hears footsteps behind
A shovel’s echo lingers, metal tastes fear
Crow feathers scatter, mute quarrel with dawn
A child's shoe buried, the pair missing
Dust on marble lips, kisses turned grit
Roots buckle paths, the dead rearrange floors
A thorn crown hangs, rust blessing the nails
Stale bread on graves, saints feed sparrows
Wet wool smell, mourners steaming like horses
Moonlight puddles, slick on carved ribs
A slate cracks loud, silence mends slower
Candles drowned in rain, wishes go dark
Dandelions flare yellow, rude as laughter
A rosary snapped, beads lost like years
Black sap oozes, tree drinks old stories
Footfalls count wrong, ground keeps its own time
A hat waits on stone, its man late
Fog eats lanterns, leaves teeth of glow
Hollow underfoot, coffins speak in knocks
White cat watches, eyes two cold coins
Worn path between names, gossip never ends
Blood on the fence, bargain paid twice
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE

description: Cemetery is ground that remembers, a place where the living walk on a thin crust of soil over regret, unfinished business, and deliberate forgetting. Names on stone fade, graves sink, and the boundary between “laid to rest” and “not quite gone” is more a matter of courtesy than law.

name: Locations

tableData.result: Sunken graves along the silted creek
Gatehouse of rusted keys and sighs
Mausoleum choked with black ivy
Bone orchard behind the tannery wall
Widow’s row of tilted stones
Grave pit where the snow won’t lie
Bell post for the buried awake
Caretaker’s hut with one warm chair
Field of swords planted as markers
Children’s corner hung with mute ribbons
Charnel steps slick with old fat
Gravel lane walked thin by mourners
Crypt of nameless kings, locks broken
Flooded parcel with fish in coffins
Ash circle where paupers were burned
Collapsed tomb swallowed by patient roots
Fox den beneath the parson’s slab
Boundary ditch salted and salted again
Stone angel with a cracked smile
Memorial wall pitted by musket fire
Gravedigger’s barrow stacked with fresh earth
Saint’s reliquary smeared with candle grease
War trench re-used as family plot
Lime pit buzzing with fat blue flies
Marker field where names were bought
Old gallows stump turned grave post
Frozen patch that never thaws
Crossroads mound seeded with iron nails
Bleached steps to the under-vault
Dog skull shrine kept by beggars
Row of stones facing the wrong sun
Unblessed corner fenced with thorn
Caretaker’s ledger nailed to a tree
Broken ossuary spilling teeth like rice
Wishing well filled with funeral coins
Grief garden of black tulips
Stone path worn by penitents’ knees
Sealed pit humming with trapped breath
Funeral pyre hill still warm beneath
Mother’s grave marked by a toy horse
Watchtower where crows are fed meat
Rootbound coffin wedged in exposed clay
Snowdome of stacked skulls and rime
Whispering niche carved behind the altar
Grave of the hangman with rope
Salt-ringed plot kept from hungry worms
Field bellows pumping air to dirt
THE WEAVE
DESCRIPTOR + FOCUS
ROLL TWICE

description: Cemetery is ground that remembers, a place where the living walk on a thin crust of soil over regret, unfinished business, and deliberate forgetting. Names on stone fade, graves sink, and the boundary between “laid to rest” and “not quite gone” is more a matter of courtesy than law.

name: Discoveries

tableData.result: Sunken grave with fresh child's footprint
Stone angel missing face, weeps rusty water
Grave dirt warm despite winter frost
Broken bell rope tied to coffin
Name chiseled away, nails hammered in
Caretaker’s shovel stained black, still wet
Mourning veil snagged on thigh-high thorns
Open ledger listing unpaid burial debts
Candles burning cold blue without flame
Mass grave marked by gnawed wooden spoon
Maggot-threaded wreath arranged with soldier buttons
Whisper hole beneath slab, breath answers
Bone dice scattered around a child’s toy
Grave of twins, only one heartbeat
Spade-shaped key hidden in a jawbone
Grave robbers’ ladder nailed under turf
Boot prints circle a grave, then stop
Old priest’s tongue pinned to epitaph
Iron fence grows inward like prison bars
Coffin lid scratched with days and bargains
Ragged dog guarding a thief’s tomb
Coins on eyes fuse into green mask
Moss writes names the stone forgot
Funeral mask of lead, warm to touch
Bloodstain around urn, no body found
Hollow statue throat echoes other names
Milk left for the restless turns black
Rotted banner flaps a battle’s dirge
Kneeling bench grooved by bitten knuckles
Crow carries ring, drops it on yours
Faint lullaby underfoot, words chew bone
Door-sized slate sealed with children’s chalk
Fresh lilacs planted in cursed soil
Crumbling mausoleum locked from inside tonight
Worms spelling a message, then scatter
Pitted helmet used as rain-cup altar
Paper prayer boats sail a mud puddle
Wooden hand protrudes, jointed like prayer
Ash-filled skull warming a beggar’s hands
Grave candles flicker toward a single name
Razor wire wreath around the traitor’s stone
Golden tooth embedded in a rootsnarl
Carved epitaph changes tense at dusk
Broken violin tucked under a widow’s mound
Bootheel on a rib, still flexing
Stairs down that end at firm soil
Ink-black moths swarming a newborn marker

description: Cemetery is ground that remembers, a place where the living walk on a thin crust of soil over regret, unfinished business, and deliberate forgetting. Names on stone fade, graves sink, and the boundary between “laid to rest” and “not quite gone” is more a matter of courtesy than law.

name: Banes

tableData.result: Sunken graves swallow boots and balance
Name-stones lie, spawning fights over ghosts
Bone-thieves stalk, blades oiled and hungry
Wet clay grips ankles with patient spite
Mourner’s wail draws things that pity nothing
Grave smoke curls, stinging eyes and memory
Rot-sweet air dulls sense and judgment
Caretaker demands coin, then betrayal
Rotted coffins pop, spilling restless secrets
Unmarked mounds hide traps of grief
Bell rope twitches with no living hand
Black moss poisons cuts, fever follows
Cold hands tug cloaks when backs turn
Procession blocks path, insists you join
Ossuary whispers bargains paid in siblings
Rain uncovers jawbones that bite back
Names fade; contracts do not fade
Crossed iron bent, wards broken, spirits bold
Grave robbers frame you with stolen rings
Widow’s curse clings like damp wool
Digging stirs rats fat on ancestors
Funeral wine spoils, visions sour minds
Caretaker’s dog knows your guilty scent
Tombs echo footsteps that aren’t yours
Old soldier demands duel for peace
Child-sized prints circle fresh soil
Death-taxes levied by knife and ledger
Lanterns fail; will-o-wisps offer paths
Gravedust in lungs breeds unquiet sleep
Mausoleum doors close, locks learn names
Chimes toll debts owed by the living
Ancestor masks watch, judge, and hiss
Shrine offerings crawl with maggots of luck
Shovel strikes skull; the skull complains
Caretaker counts shovels, finds one missing
Grief-mad priest names you grave-kin
Root-knotted limbs trip vows to gods
Coins on tongues burn greedy fingers
Pox spreads from shared mourning cloth
Grave markers rearrange to false maps
Ghouls wear familiar faces, almost right
Mud sucks screams deeper than prayers
Epitaph riddles demand shameful answers
Skylarks silent; only crows give counsel
Widower hires you to exhume himself
Gate hinges shriek oaths you broke
Night watch sells routes to the dead
Fresh flowers bloom black, bees drunk
OBJECTIVES
DESCRIPTOR + FOCUS

description: Cemetery is ground that remembers, a place where the living walk on a thin crust of soil over regret, unfinished business, and deliberate forgetting. Names on stone fade, graves sink, and the boundary between “laid to rest” and “not quite gone” is more a matter of courtesy than law.

name: Boons

tableData.result: Grave soil grips your footsteps silent
Names on stone whisper true directions
Cold marrow steadies shaking sword hand
Moonlit epitaph reveals enemy’s hidden sin
Rattling bones distract foes at clutch moments
Funeral hush muffles your ragged breath
Worm-song warns of ambush beneath roots
Graveyard gate opens for you alone
Charnel stink masks your living scent
Old mourner’s coin buys passage from shades
Crossed spades unearth a needed memory
Mossy slab offers shelter from witchfire
Bell-rope tugs when danger nears
Gravedust blinds the proud for heartbeats
Lamplight lingers, showing safe stepping stones
Raven guides you to rightful corpse
Shroud-wrapped prayer softens ruthless blows
Skull grin spooks coward hearts to flight
Hollow lullaby lulls restless spirits harmless
Broken marker points to hidden cache
Pale lilies sour trackers’ keen noses
Last rites seal wounds closed until dawn
Ancestor’s whisper steadies your next lie
Funeral march times your perfect escape
Sunken plot swallows evidence of sin
Bone dice roll honest beneath dead eyes
Cracked urn yields ash that wards curses
Caretaker’s nod grants brief sanctuary
Rain on graves washes tracks clean
Sexton’s keys open forbidden iron locks
Quiet grief dulls the taste of fear
Dead man’s name unlocks stubborn doors
Mourning veil hides tears and intentions
Ossuary echoes reveal unseen footfalls
Black dog leads you round pitfalls
Unearthed ring binds grudges to obedience
Coffin nail turns blade true once
Dirt-scribed sigils confuse hungry ghosts
Funeral bread steels you against temptation
Grave chill cools fevered blood quickly
Epitaph rhyme breaks bewitchment for moments
Penny on tongue buys precious silence
Rooted yew bends arrows off course
Caretaker’s whistle calls crows to harry
Lantern smoke shows truthful path forward
Mound-shadow cloaks you from moon watchers
Mortcloth catches poison before it bites
Shared vigil forges trust in killers
